"J. B. Rainsberger" wrote:

> Quoting numbsafari <numbsafari@...>:
>
> > Actually, I don't mean to be a critic, but the documentation for
> > J/Unit really sucks. I know, I know... if I don't like it I should do
> > better... [...]
>
> Be critical -- we'll probably all agree with you. What kind of documentation is
> missing? I, for one, have written a Starter's Guide. Mike Clark has a really
> good primer. Is this not the documentation you need? Maybe someone with some
> experience could be convinced to share some knowledge if there's an area of the
> framework, its usage or testing patterns that you need to know about.
>
> Go to the Articles section of http://www.junit.org -- it may help.
>

I second that.  And if you don't find what you're looking for anywhere, let us
know.  If I know something about the topic, I'll write about it.  If I don't, I'm
sure others will.  If you're looking for formal training, that's available as well.

It's an emergent community.  Ask nicely and you'll probably receive bountifully.

Mike
